attributes.text: @dev getter method created from variable definition
@dev getter method created from variable definition
@dev getter method created from variable definition
@dev checks the inflation and sets the inflation parameters if the inflation cycle has changed
@dev returns the properties pertaining to inflation
@dev Emitted when setting vesting timelock contract address
@dev Emitted when setting max limit supply

SetSupplyMaxLimit(address,uint256).details: Emitted when setting max limit supply

SetVestingTimelockContract(address).details: Emitted when setting vesting timelock contract address

_lastInflationBlockTime().details: getter method created from variable definition

_supplyMaxLimit().details: getter method created from variable definition

_totalInflatedSupply().details: getter method created from variable definition

addVesting(address,uint256,uint256,uint2.details: adds a vesting grant initiated by this contract as manager

allowance(address,address).details: Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` will be allowed to spend on behalf of `owner` through {transferFrom}. This is zero by default. This value changes when {approve} or {transferFrom} are called.

approve(address,uint256).details: Sets `amount` as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's tokens. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. IMPORTANT: Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729 Emits an {Approval} event.

balanceOf(address).details: Returns the amount of tokens owned by `account`.

checkInflation().details: checks the inflation and sets the inflation parameters if the inflation cycle has changed

getInflation().details: returns the properties pertaining to inflation

mint(address,uint256).details: Mints `amount` tokens to the caller's address `to`. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

pause().details: Triggers stopped state. Requirements: - The contract must not be paused.

params.inflationPeriod: : inflation cycle in seconds Emits a {SetInflationRate} event.
params.inflationRate: : inflation rate given as value between 0 and 100

setSupplyMaxLimit(uint256).details: Set supply max limit of the inflation component

params.supplyMaxLimit: : supply max limit value Emits a {SetSupplyMaxLimit} event.

params.vestingTimelockAddress: : VestingTimelockcontract address Emits a {SetVestingTimelockContract} event with '_contract' set to the VestingTimelockcontract address.

totalSupply().details: Returns the amount of tokens in existence.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to `recipient`. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Moves `amount` tokens from `sender` to `recipient` using the allowance mechanism. `amount` is then deducted from the caller's allowance. Returns a boolean value indicating whether the operation succeeded. Emits a {Transfer} event.

unpause().details: Returns to normal state. Requirements: - The contract must be paused.
